gurmukhi: ju`D ko Awvq BUp jbY biRjnwiek Awpny nYn inhwrXo ] TwF rhXo nih qaun Drw pr Awgy hI ju`D ko Awp isDwrXo ]
transliteration: Juddh Ko Aavat Bhoop Jabai Brijnaaik Aapane Nain Nihdaryo|| Thaadh Rahyo Nah(i) Tau Dharaa Parr Aage Hijuddh Ko Aap Sidhdaryo||
translation: When Krishna saw the king coming to the battlefield, he also did not stay there, but marched forward for fighting;

gurmukhi: mwq hau quh kO Ab hI rhu TwF Ary ieh BwNiq aucwrXo ] Xo kih kY pun swrMg ko qn kY sr S`qR hiRdY mih mwrXo ]2137]
transliteration: Maarat Hau Tuh Kau Ab Hirahu Thaadhdare Eh Bhaant(i) Ouchdaryo|| Yo Kah(i) Kai Poun Saaran Ko Tan Kai Sar Shatra Bridai Maih Mdaryo||2137||
translation: He said, “O king ! stay there, I shall kill you now;” saying this and pulling his bow, he discharged an arrow into the heart of the enemy.2137.

gurmukhi: swrMg qwn jbY Air ko biRjnwiek qICn bwn clwXo ] lwgq hI igr BUm BUmwsur JUm prXo jmlok isDwXo ]
transliteration: Saaran Taan Jabai Ar(i) Ko Brijnaaik Teechhan Baan Chalaayo|| Laagad Higir Bhoom Bhoomaasur Jhoom Pdaryo Jamlok Sidhaayo||
translation: When pulling his bow, Krishna discharged his sharp arrow, then being hit by the arrow, Bhumasura swung and fell down on the ground and went to the abode of Yama;

gurmukhi: sRaun lgXo nih qw sr kO ieh BwNiq clwkI so pwr prwXo ] jog ky swDk ijau qn qXwg clXo nB pwp n Bytn pwXo ]2138]
transliteration: Sraoun Lagyo Nah(i) Taa Sar Kau Eh Bhaant(i) Chalaakiso Paar Paraayo|| Jog Ke Saadhak Jio Tan Tyaag Chadyo Nabh Paap Na Bhetan Paayo||2138||
translation: The arrow penetrated through his body with such swiftness that even the blood could not smear it and he like the one engaged in Yogic discipline, abandoned his body and sins, went away to heaven.2138.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtk gRMQy kiRSnw Avqwry BUmwsur bDy ]
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Naatak Granthe Krishnaa Avtdare Bhoomaasur Badhe||
translation: End of the description of killing of Bhumasura in Krishnavatara in Bachittar Natak.

gurmukhi: AQ ausky puqR ko rwj dyq By ] solw shMsR rwj suqw ibAwh kQnM ]
transliteration: Ath Ouske Poutra Ko Raaj Det Bhe|| Solaa Sahansra Raaj Soutaa Beeah Kathanan||
translation: Now begins the description of giving his kingdom to his son and marriage with sixteen thousand princesses

gurmukhi: AYsI dSw jb BI ieh kI qb mwie BUmwsur kI suin DweI ] BUm ky aUpr JUm igrI suD bsqRn kI icq qy ibsrweI ]
transliteration: Aisidashaa Jab Bhieh Kitab Maae Bhoomaasur Kisoun(i) Dhaaee|| Bhm Ke Oopar Jhoom Girisudh Bastran Kichit Te Bisaaee||
translation: When Bhumasura passed through such a phase, then his mother came and paying no attention to her clothes etc., she became unconscious and fell upon the earth;

gurmukhi: pwie n fwrq BI pnIAw su auqwvl sO cil sXwm pY AweI ] dyKq sXwm ko rIJ rhI duK BUl gXO su qo kIn bfweI ]2139]
transliteration: Paae Na Daarat Bhipaneeaa Su Outaaval Sou Chal(i) Syaam Pai Aaee|| Dekhat Syaam Ko Reejh Rahidoukh Bhool Gyau Su To Keen Badaaee||2139||
translation: She being greatly worried, came with bare feet to Krishna and seeing him, she forgot her affliction and became pleased.2139.

gurmukhi: bhu ausqq jdupiq krI lIno sXwm irJwie ] pauqR Awn pwien frXo so lIno bKSwie ]2140]
transliteration: Bahu Oustat Jadoupat(i) Karileeno Syaam Rijhaa|| Paoutra Aan Pin Daryo So Leeno Bkhshaae||2140||
translation: She praised Krishna and pleased him and her son(s) fell on the feet of Krihsna, whom he pardoned and set him free.2140.
